channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023080271
item.description:
Report X-2023080271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler discovered package when putting away tugger and brought to QA attention and QA got right to work. DescribePack: the package was discovered on its side with what looks like was pushed off IC belt which is probably what caused cap to come loose and leak contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed upright in hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080263
item.description:
Report X-2023080263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the hazmat cage, it had been dropped and the lid and upper part of the pail had been dented and crushed. Leakage was evident at the seal between the lid and the pail. Pail was placed in a Hazmat tote with a lid. DescribePack: dented and crushed at the top of the container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The immediate area was evacuated and the container was moved to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023071236
item.description:
Report X-2023071236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE AND SPILL CART. UPON ARRIVING, RESPONDER NOTICED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID PACKAGE LEAKING AS WELL. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL. PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED MATERIAL WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023080051
item.description:
Report E-2023080051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit on I-70 eastbound in St. Louis, MO the XPO truck/trailer was involved in a rollover accident which damaged nine of the metal 55 gallon drums of 2-pentanone(un1993) but only releasing 0.5 quart from a damaged bung. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
